name: webgl-earth-bars
description:
The Earth dataviz template renders geolocated data bars on a rotating 3D globe. The template is a wrapper around the WebGL Globe experiment and only works on Web browsers that support WebGL. For more details about the experiment, check:
http://www.chromeexperiments.com/detail/webgl-globe/

The template works best with data feeds defined in spreadsheets. Such spreadsheets must define the following columns: 'Title', 'Latitude', 'Longitude', and 'Value'.

The template may also be used to render geo objects from KML sources provided the 'Elevation' is set to a non zero value.

Preview pane is disabled because of the dependency on WebGL. Copy and paste the preview address directly on a Web browser that supports WebGL to preview your application.

main.title: Geo data
main.description: Must have geotagging. Spreadsheets must define a 'Latitude', 'Longitude' and 'Value' columns.
